intro: Aetheolaena mochensis, commonly known as the Moché orchid, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in rocky or mountainous terrain. Its flowers are usually pale green or white, with intricate patterns that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
